body_html: @max1000000 You can't install the package from PYPI (using pip) since it's not officially released on Windows. And please read the notice carefully, especially the About CI packages section. I think I have stated things carefully there. The thing you'll have to do is to click the icon(Windows CPU/GPU 0.3.0 in the first table there), pick the package that is suitable for you and finally download and install it.

body: @max1000000 You can't install the package from PYPI (using pip) since it's not officially released on Windows. And please read the notice carefully, especially the __About CI packages__ section. I think I have stated things carefully there. The thing you'll have to do is to click the icon(Windows CPU/GPU 0.3.0 in the first table there), pick the package that is suitable for you and finally download and install it.
